sentences.en: Capable workers are the lifeblood of the business.
sentences.cn: 能干的工人是工商企业的生命力.

sentences.en: Coal and steel were the region's lifeblood.
sentences.cn: 煤炭和钢铁曾是这个地区的生命线。

sentences.en: Demand chain management will be seen as the lifeblood of enterprises.
sentences.cn: 需求链管理成为21世纪企业的生命线.

sentences.en: Fast communications are the lifeblood of a successful enterprise.
sentences.cn: 快速的交通设备是成功企业的命脉.

sentences.en: Irrigation, which is the lifeblood of agriculture, also merits close attention.
sentences.cn: 水利是农业的命脉, 我们也应予以极大的注意.

sentences.en: Membership development and extension are the lifeblood of Rotary.
sentences.cn: 社员发展及扩展是扶轮维系生命的鲜血.

sentences.en: No wonder, information is sometimes called the lifeblood of a control system.
sentences.cn: 难怪信息有时称作为控制系统的生命线.

sentences.en: Power, heat, light, water and transportation are the lifeblood of cities.
sentences.cn: 电力, 暖气, 灯光, 饮水及运输是城市的活力来源.

sentences.en: Research and development is the lifeblood of our business.
sentences.cn: 研究开发是我们的生命线.

sentences.en: Small businesses are the lifeblood of the economy.
sentences.cn: 小型企业是经济的生命力所在。

sentences.en: The boy is the lifeblood of his parents.
sentences.cn: 这男孩是他父母的命根子.

sentences.en: The manager says that the customers are our lifeblood.
sentences.cn: 经理说,顾客就是我们的命根子.

sentences.en: They are the lifeblood of the company.
Tourism is the lifeblood of the city.
sentences.cn: 旅游业是这座城市的命脉。

sentences.en: Trade is the lifeblood of our country.

words.tran_cn: 无生命的；死气沉沉的；无趣味的

trans.tran_cn: 命脉，命根子，生命线，<文>血液
